Metadata: Larval culture of the American lobster ("Homarus americanus")
"CRC Handbook of Mariculture," Volume 1: Crustacean Aquaculture, James P. McVey, ed., pp. 489-495, 1993.

The University of California Bodega Marine Laboratory obtains gravid female lobsters ("Homarus americanus") from a variety of sources. The laboratory also maintains its own broodstock. Continuous production of larvae can be achieved using a combination of temperature and photoperiod to orchestrate the reproductive cycle of females to schedule egg extrusions throughout the year. This publication renews successful larval culture techniques.
